trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the property to which the attribute is applied supports device filtering.
This class cannot be inherited.
The FilterableAttribute attribute is applied to a property to specify whether the property supports device filtering.
When a property supports device filtering, you can override the value of a property for a specific device by specifying a device filter.
By default, properties are filterable, so a control developer could prevent device filtering on a property by setting the FilterableAttribute attribute to `false`.
For more information, see [Customizing for Specific Devices](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/a7f55dfa-290b-45f8-bf8f-d5a4540bae61).
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the FilterableAttribute class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Filterable%2A>|The value of the `filterable` parameter.|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the property to which the attribute is applied supports device filtering; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Represents a predefined <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute"></xref> object with default property settings.
This field is read-only.
The Default field represents a predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object with default property settings.
This field is often used when comparing a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object to the predefined object.
> [!NOTE] > The Default field is identical to the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> field.
To be added.
Determines whether the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute"></xref> class is equal to the specified object.
Use the Equals method to determine whether the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class is equal to the specified object.
For the objects to be equal, they must meet the following criteria: 1.
The object contained in the `obj` parameter must be a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Filterable%2A> property of both objects must be equal.
> [!NOTE] > This method is used primarily by control developers.
The <xref:System.Object> to compare with this instance.
if the object contained in the obj parameter is equal to the current instance of the object; otherwise, .
Gets a value indicating whether the property to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute"></xref> attribute is applied supports device filtering.
Use the Filterable property to determine whether the property to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute is applied supports device filtering.
When a property supports device filtering, you can override the value of a property for a specific device by specifying a device filter.
For more information, see [Customizing for Specific Devices](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/a7f55dfa-290b-45f8-bf8f-d5a4540bae61).

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the property to which the attribute is applied supports device filtering; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Determines whether the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute"></xref> class is equal to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Default"></xref> attribute.

The IsDefaultAttribute method is a helper method used by ASP.NET to determine whether the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> class is equal to the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Default> field.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the current instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute"></xref> is equal to <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.Default"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref:System.Object> supports device filtering.
Use the IsObjectFilterable method to determine whether the specified <xref:System.Object> supports device filtering.
> [!NOTE] > An object supports device filtering if its data type supports device filtering.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute.IsTypeFilterable%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Object> to test.
if the contained in the instance parameter supports device filtering; otherwise, .
The instance parameter is .
Determines whether a property supports device filtering.
Use the IsPropertyFilterable method to determine whether a property supports device filtering.
To use this method, you must pass in a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> object that contains the properties of the property to test.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> that contains the properties of the property to test.
if the property represented by the object contained in the propertyDescriptor parameter supports device filtering; otherwise, .
Determines whether the specified data type supports device filtering.
Use the IsTypeFilterable method to determine whether the specified type supports device filtering.
A type supports device filtering if it has a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> attribute applied to it.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the data type to test.
if the data type contained in the type parameter supports device filtering; otherwise, .
The type parameter is .
Represents a predefined <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute"></xref> object that indicates that a property does not support device filtering.
This field is read-only.
The No field represents a predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object that indicates that a property does not support device filtering.
This field is often used when comparing a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object to the predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object.
To be added.
Represents a predefined <xref href="System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute"></xref> object that indicates that a property supports device filtering.
This field is read-only.
The Yes field represents a predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object that indicates that a property supports device filtering.
This field is often used when comparing a <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object to the predefined <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object.
> [!NOTE] > This is the default <xref:System.Web.UI.FilterableAttribute> object.
To be added.
